intro: Stereospermum randrianaivoi, commonly known as the Madagascar trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soil and full sunlight.
